title: Does DNA have the equivalent of IF-statements, WHILE loops, or function calls?
dot:
digraph DNA_Programming_Analogies{graph[rankdir=LR, fontname="Helvetica", splines=ortho, nodesep=0.5, ranksep=2.0];node[shape=box, fontname="Helvetica", style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];IF[label="IF-statement
(Transcriptional Activator)", tooltip="Gene transcribed if condition met"];WHILE[label="WHILE loop
(Transcriptional Repressor)", tooltip="Gene transcribed until repressor absent"];FUNCTION[label="Function call
(Not equivalent in DNA)", tooltip="No separate environment for functions"];GOTO[label="GOTO statement
(Conditional Pathways)", tooltip="Direct impact on downstream events"];IF->WHILE[label="Part of a loop", fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];WHILE->IF[label="Loop continuation", fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];FUNCTION->GOTO[label="No direct equivalent", style=dashed, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];GOTO->IF[label="Conditional bypass", fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];label="DNA and Programming Constructs Analogies";fontsize=20;fontname="Helvetica-Bold";}
